intro: Mentha obtusata, commonly known as woolly mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and square stems, typical of the mint family. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Mentha obtusata is valued for its aromatic leaves and has been used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
